intro: Pedicularis pteridifolia, commonly known as the fern-leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its fern-like leaves and striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and alpine meadows. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often of interest to botanists and conservationists.
